In thought and expression there is considerable resemblance between our epistle and the writings of Clelnent of Rome, and especially of Hermas. There is however no reason to suppose any literary connexion between them. They resemble one another, simply because they were produced under the same con- ditions. This view is confirmed by the fact that no trace of our epistle is to be found throughout the 2nd century. Hegesippus knows nothing osan · epistle of Jaines.
